Description: Fragment (mended from eight sherds) of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater, consisting of rim, neck and shoulder; interior: glazed black (fired partly red) inside neck, with possible band in added red at top of sherd; shoulder streaky black; exterior: on top of lip, incised spoked rosettes with red centres and petals usually alternating black and red; part of handle plate preserved with palmette with alternating red and black leaves between volutes; black line at outer edge; on outside of lip, frieze of stepped zigzags; underside of lip partly reserved and partly streaky black; outside of neck black; on shoulder, black-figure decoration consisting of part of panther to left (red on ears, neck and dabs on forehead); at left, part of uncertain creature or filling ornament; inscription on exterior.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.1)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 259-260, no. B177)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 66, no. 799, pl. XXI, no. 799)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 243, no. 1)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 686, no. 447, pl. 29.1-2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0117) (Phase 1)
Alexandridou 2011 / The Early Black-Figured Pottery of Attika in Context (c. 630-570BCE) (p. 124) (Naukratis 114)
